DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to examine the effects of nattokinase supplementation on hemostatic factors in nondiabetic and hypercholesterolemic subjects. Collagen-epinephrine closure time, prothrombin time, activated partial thromboplastin time, fibrinogen levels, and lipid profiles were measured at baseline and at 8-week follow-up.
DOC.criteria: Age between 20 and 69 years Hypercholesterolemia (200mg/dL ≤ serum cholesterol ≤ 280mg/dL) Nondiabetic (fasting blood glucose < 126mg/dL and 2hour blood glucose < 200mg/dL) Use of any medication or supplements Diagnosis of dyslipidemia, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, liver disease, renal disease, cardiovascular disease, pancreatitis, cancer, or any lifethreatening illness that required regular medical treatment Women who were pregnant, breastfeeding or intending to become pregnant during the study period Drug or alcohol abuse
